questions.question: What is AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio designed to do?
questions.answer: AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio is designed to improve the interactive experience of using ComfyUI, such as making the loading of models more intuitive and creating model thumbnails.

questions.question: How does AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio enhance model thumbnail creation?
questions.answer: AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio provides a one-click generation of model thumbnails, or users can use local images as thumbnails.

questions.question: What is the Model shielding feature in AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio used for?
questions.answer: The Model shielding feature is used to exclude certain models from appearing in the loader.

questions.question: How does AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio automatically label models?
questions.answer: AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio automatically labels the outer folder of the model and adds labels such as 'SD1.5' and 'real' as labels for the A.ckpt model.

questions.question: Which loaders are supported by AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?
questions.answer: AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio supports standard named custom node types like 'ckpt_name', 'vae_name', 'clip_name', etc. It also supports 'Standard Nodes', 'ImageOnlyCheckpointLoader', 'CheckpointLoaderSimple', 'unCLIPCheckpointLoader', 'VAELoader', 'CLIPVisionLoader', 'GLIGENLoader', 'ControlNetLoader', 'LoraLoaderModelOnly', 'LoraLoader', 'StyleModelLoader', 'UpscaleModelLoader', 'HypernetworkLoader', 'CLIPLoader', 'DualCLIPLoader', and 'UNETLoader'.

questions.question: Can AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio be installed on macOS or Linux?
questions.answer: No, AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio can only be installed on Windows 10 or 11. It is equivalent to a custom node and can be placed in the custom_nodes folder within ComfyUI.

questions.question: How do you activate AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio within ComfyUI?
questions.answer: To activate AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio within ComfyUI, left click on model switch to pop up the ComfyUI Studio Manager. If you still need to use the original model list, use Shift+left click on model switch to pop up the original model list.
